soba_userInput: create an alternative mind map for baroque music, better organised, and completing the missing information of the model
soba_metaModelContext:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ecore:EPackage xmi:version="2.0" xmlns:xmi="http://www.omg.org/XMI" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ecore="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" name="mindMap" nsURI="http://mindmap/0.1" nsPrefix="map">
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="Map">
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="name">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="description">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="root" eType="//Concept" containment="true"/>
  </eClassifiers>
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="Concept">
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="name">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="subConcepts" upperBound="-1" eType="//Concept" containment="true" eOpposite="//Concept/parent"/>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="parent" eType="//Concept" eOpposite="//Concept/subConcepts"/>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="description">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="relatedTo" upperBound="-1" eType="//Concept"/>
  </eClassifiers>
</ecore:EPackage>

subConcepts.name: Claudio Monteverdi
subConcepts.description: Pioneer of Baroque music and opera.

subConcepts.name: Italian Composers
subConcepts.description: Notable Italian composers of the early Baroque period.

subConcepts.name: Michael Praetorius
subConcepts.description: German composer known for his instrumental and choral music.

subConcepts.name: German Composers
subConcepts.description: Important German composers of the early Baroque.

subConcepts.name: Early Baroque (1580–1650)
subConcepts.description: The beginning phase of Baroque music.

subConcepts.name: Arcangelo Corelli
subConcepts.description: Italian violinist and composer, influential in Baroque instrumental music.

subConcepts.name: Jean-Baptiste Lully
subConcepts.description: French composer who developed French Baroque music and opera.

subConcepts.name: Middle Baroque (1630–1700)
subConcepts.description: The middle phase of Baroque music development.

subConcepts.name: Johann Sebastian Bach
subConcepts.description: German composer and musician, master of Baroque counterpoint.

subConcepts.name: George Frideric Handel
subConcepts.description: Baroque composer famous for operas, oratorios, and concerti grossi.

subConcepts.name: Antonio Vivaldi
subConcepts.description: Italian Baroque composer known for his violin concertos.

subConcepts.name: Late Baroque (1680–1750)
subConcepts.description: The final phase of Baroque music, characterized by complexity and grandeur.

subConcepts.name: History
subConcepts.description: Historical periods and key composers of Baroque music.

subConcepts.name: Overture
subConcepts.description: Opening instrumental movement.

subConcepts.name: Allemande
subConcepts.description: A moderate tempo dance in 4/4 time.

subConcepts.name: Courante
subConcepts.description: A lively dance in triple meter.

subConcepts.name: Sarabande
subConcepts.description: A slow, stately dance in triple meter.

subConcepts.name: Gigue
subConcepts.description: A fast dance, often the final movement.

subConcepts.name: Dance Suite
subConcepts.description: A collection of dance movements.

subConcepts.name: Concerto
subConcepts.description: A musical composition for solo instrument(s) and orchestra.

subConcepts.name: Fugue
subConcepts.description: A contrapuntal compositional technique.

subConcepts.name: Instrumental Music
subConcepts.description: Instrumental forms and styles in Baroque music.

subConcepts.name: Origin
subConcepts.description: Invented in Italy around 1600.

subConcepts.name: Libretto
subConcepts.description: The text or script of the opera.

subConcepts.name: Themes
subConcepts.description: Historical or mythological subjects.

subConcepts.name: Opera
subConcepts.description: Theatrical art form combining music, drama, and stagecraft.

subConcepts.name: Oratorio
subConcepts.description: Large-scale musical work for orchestra and voices, usually religious.

subConcepts.name: Cantata
subConcepts.description: Vocal composition with instrumental accompaniment.

subConcepts.name: Vocal Music
subConcepts.description: Vocal forms including religious and secular music.

subConcepts.name: Genres and Forms
subConcepts.description: Main genres and musical forms of Baroque music.

subConcepts.name: Timbre
subConcepts.description: Distinctive tone color or quality of sound.

subConcepts.name: Texture
subConcepts.description: The way melodic, rhythmic, and harmonic materials are combined.

subConcepts.name: Harmony
subConcepts.description: Use of basso continuo and functional tonality.

subConcepts.name: Imitation
subConcepts.description: Repetition of a melody in a different voice.

subConcepts.name: Counterpoint
subConcepts.description: Technique of combining independent melodic lines.

subConcepts.name: Polyphony
subConcepts.description: Multiple independent melody lines played simultaneously.

subConcepts.name: Musical Features
subConcepts.description: Characteristics and elements of Baroque music.

root.name: Baroque Music
root.description: Central concept of Baroque music with detailed organization.

recommendationPayload.name: Baroque Music Alternative Map
recommendationPayload.description: An alternative, better organized mind map for Baroque music with completed missing information.
